NO QUESTIONS BY MR SWANEPOEL
Mr Chisoma, besides the fact that Mr Zulu was an IFP member, was there anything else that he had done or said that led you to killing him?
We knew him from 1990.  The reason we left our places and ran away, it was because of them, it was because of the IFP members.

No, I'm asking about Mr Zulu specifically.  Was there anything that he himself had done, who had participated perhaps in the activities of the other IFP members, that led to people having to leave their homes.
Why was it necessary to kill him, as opposed to telling him he must stop it?
It wasn't easy to tell an IFP member to stop.  We knew him as an IFP member and the reason we ran away in 1990 was because of them.

Yes, I know that but did Mr Zulu do any specific - I mean, if you killed Mr Zulu, would the IFP's power be reduced?  What purpose did his death serve?  Was he a leader of some sort or something like that?
He was just a member of IFP, I won't know if he was a leader or not but he used to go to every Inkatha meeting.  We used to see them.  I was staying in Extension 2 and he was staying there.
What they were doing to us in 1990.
So you killed him for something he did in 1990?
He was still a member of IFP and he was still participating as a member.
And what was he doing as a member?
When they attacked Polla Park, he was one of them.  We knew him all along as an IFP member.
I'm not interested in whether he was an IFP member or not, I want to know if there is any other reason, other than his membership of the IFP, that he was killed?
He ran away when we wanted to kill him and when he came back we got hold of him.
When did he run away?  You didn't mention this in your evidence-in-chief.  Is the same incident or is it a separate incident?
Well let's put it this way, what has his running away got to do with the matter?  If he ran away then he wasn't a threat to you.
In his house there were too many Inkatha members.
People from Polla Park came and burn down the shacks in his house and that's when the violence started.
Did you have any other private matter against him?
The only thing I know about Mr Zulu is that he was a member of IFP.
Yes, we were given orders that we should try to eliminate Inkatha members in the township.
Why did you choose him specifically?  I mean, he's the only person that you've applied for, so there must have been a reason for you choosing him specifically.
That's because he was the only one we got hold of.  If we could have got other members we would have killed them as well.
I have difficulty in accepting that.  You went to his house to kidnap him, surely he was not the only IFP member you knew?  Is that not so?
If there was only one IFP member in Polla Park then there wouldn't be a war, would you agree?
Why didn't you go to another IFP member's house, why Mr Zulu specifically is the question?  Why didn't you kidnap somebody else, another member of the IFP?
In my section it was only Mr Zulu who was an IFP member, the rest had run away at that time.
And it took four years to go and kidnap him?  He must have been very illusive.
Would you please repeat your question?

How come then if Mr Zulu was your target, that it took you four years, almost four years to get him?  He must have been very illusive, and if he was such a clever man to elude you, you catch him in his house.  It doesn't make sense.  Can you explain it?
In those years, 1990, IFP members were the ones with guns.  We didn't have guns, so we didn't even try but in 1994 it was easy for us because in those years we also had guns.
Ja.  1994, that's three years and some months after he was party to chasing you away from your home, was he still an active member of the IFP?
Yes, he was still an IFP member.
Now what did he do that irritated you in 1994, the time he was killed more or less, in those few months or weeks?
It's what they've done in 1993.  Some of them ran away.  Those that I know from my section, it was Mduduzi and Mr Zulu and another man.

We used to call meetings in our section and they never wanted to co-operate with us or with the community, and they supported Inkatha and they would tell the community that they were not involved in those meetings.  And they had guns in those years, so we didn't have a chance to attack them.
But why would you want to attack somebody who refused to come to a meeting?  What's wrong with saying I don't want to come to a meeting?
He had done a lot from 1990.

That's what I'm asking, what did he do that you didn't agree with?  You've told me now he refused to come to a meeting, that you didn't agree with, anything else that made him deserving of being killed and kidnapped?
He's done a lot.  We used to call meetings for youth and we never used to continue with those meetings because they would stop us, they never wanted the youth to hold meetings.
They used to harass us.  They would come with guns and we would be scared and ran away because we were scared.  And in those years we didn't have guns.
I see.  So he was seen as the disruptive force of your democratic processes, like meetings?
Yes, he never agreed with what we used to do.
Anything else you want to mention about what he did?
He will attend IFP meetings and I used to consider him as a leader because he never missed any IFP meeting.

But at that stage, a few weeks before the election in 1994, because you killed him in March/April '94 and the election was in April '94, there was already an agreement at Kempton Park, that all political parties would participate in the election and that they could hold meetings, even the IFP, was it necessary at that stage still to kill him?
Meneer and Ben(?) had given us orders and they never came back to us to tell us to stop, therefore we didn't get that message that we should stop.
When did they give you the order to kill him or to kill IFPs?
I'm not sure, I think it was four months before the incident.

In an attempt to be short and quick, I only focused on those issues that were led.  I appreciate that it's not evidence in relationship to the applications but if it counts at all, it was my specific decision not to testify on that point, just simply because it wasn't relevant to Mr Meneer's, Mr Xebe's application and I wanted to just be specific on those issues. Mr Chisoma, do you really want us to believe that the only person whom you were involved in the killing of, that you chose to report back to your commander whilst you were running away from the police, and that this serious matter was discussed under those circumstances?

And you chose that particular time to report back to him, whilst you were running?  I put it to you that Meneer probably doesn't even know of this incident and that is why he didn't mention it, and that there was no order or instruction to go out and kill IFP generally, from Meneer.
